name: Lost for Words! 21 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
What type of garden was this singer promised?

"I beg your pardon 
I never promised you a ______ garden 
Along with the sunshine 
There's gotta be a little rain some time"
questions.explanation:
rose.

	US singer Lynn Anderson hit the charts with "Rose Garden" in 1971.The song, written by Joe South, peaked at #2 in the UK singles chart.

questions.text:
"Now laughing friends deride tears I cannot hide 
So I smile and say "when a lovely flame dies, _____ gets in your eyes" 

So, what is the excuse for the crying in this song?
questions.explanation:
smoke.

	"Smoke Gets In Your Eyes" was a hit for US doo-wop quintet The Platters in 1959.A chart topper in both the US and UK, this track was written by Otto Harbach and Jerome Kern.

questions.text:
"Nobody knows where my ______ has gone
Judy left the same time
Why was he holding her hand
When he's supposed to be mine"

What is the name of the singer's roving lover?
questions.explanation:
Johnny.

	US vocalist Lesley Gore released "It's My Party" in 1963.This US chart topper peaked at #9 in the UK singles chart.

questions.text:
"And ______, I miss you and I'm bein' good
And I'd love to be with you if only I could"

How does this lonesome lad address his girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
honey.

	These lyrics come from for Bobby Goldsboro's 1968 hit "Honey".This rather sad love song, written by Bobby Russell, was a #1 single in the US, #2 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Darkness falls across the land
The midnight hour is close at hand
Creatures ______ in search of blood"

These words were spoken in a spine-chilling manner.
questions.explanation:
crawl.

	Horror movie actor Vincent Price spoke these words on the 1983 Michael Jackson single "Thriller".This featured as the title track on Michael Jackson's US and UK chart topping 1982 album.

questions.text:
"He's so fine 
Wish he were mine 
That ______ boy over there 
The one with the wavy hair"

What word was used to describe this dapper well groomed chap?
questions.explanation:
handsome.

	"He's So Fine" first charted for US female vocal group The Chiffons in 1963.The single was a US #1 peaking at #16 in the UK. Other sixties hits by the Chiffons include "One Fine Day" and "Sweet Talkin' Guy".

questions.text:
"Judy in disguise, well, that's what you are 
Lemonade pie with a brand new car
Cantaloupe eyes come to me tonight 
Judy in disguise with ______."

So, what did Judy use as a disguise?
questions.explanation:
glasses.

	One hit wonders John Fred and His Playboy Band charted with "Judy In Disguise (With Glasses)" in 1968.A US chart topper, this single peaked at #3 in the UK

questions.text:
"It's now or never
Come hold me tight 
______ me my darling 
Be mine tonight 
Tomorrow will be too late 
It's now or never 
My love won't wait"

What sign of affection was the singer requesting?
questions.explanation:
Kiss.

	The lyrics come from Elvis Presley's 1960 hit "It's Now Or Never".Written by Aaron Schroeder and Wally Gold, the single hit the top on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text:
"Take good care of my baby 
Now don't you ever make her cry 
Just let your love surround her 
Paint a ______ all around her 
Don't let her see a cloudy sky"

What word fills the gap in this Bobby Vee lyric?
questions.explanation:
rainbow.

	"Take Good Care Of My Baby" hit the charts for Bobby Vee in 1961.A US #1, this song peaked at #3 in the UK.Bobby Vee, real name Robert Velline, had a string of hits in the early sixties including, "Rubber Ball", "Take Good Care of My Baby", and "Run to Him".

questions.text:
"Now, I don't blame him 'cause he run and hid 
But the meanest thing that he ever did 
Was before he left, he went and named me ______."

What name is the singer complaining about?
questions.explanation:
Sue.

	These lyrics come from Johnny Cash's "A Boy Named Sue".The song was a #4 UK chart hit in the 1969. Johnny Cash, known as "The Man in Black", died in 2003.
